oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.util

Class CmdArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.hadoop.vector.util.CmdArgs

  • public class CmdArgs
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains constants for some common command line arguments
    Author:
    hsaucedo

    • Field Detail

      • BOUNDARIES

        public static final java.lang.String BOUNDARIES
        The dimensions boundaries of the spatial data. It is expected as a comma-separated list of ordinates in the form dim1Min,dim2Min,dim1Max,dim2Max
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIMENSIONS

        public static final java.lang.String DIMENSIONS
        The number of dimensions of the spatial data

        The path where a hierarchy index will be stored or can be found.

      • HIERARCHY_INFO

        public static final java.lang.String HIERARCHY_INFO
        A HierarchyInfo subclass used to describe a hierarchical data set
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INDEX_MAP_FILE

        public static final java.lang.String INDEX_MAP_FILE
        Boolean parameter. Setting this value to false for spatial index generation, causes the index to be generated as a sequence file instead of a map file.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INDEX_METADATA_DIR

        public static final java.lang.String INDEX_METADATA_DIR
        The path to the directory where the spatial index metadata is stored
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INDEX_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String INDEX_NAME
        A spatial index name
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INPUT

        public static final java.lang.String INPUT
        The input data path as a path, a comma-separated list of paths or a path pattern
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INPUT_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String INPUT_FORMAT
        A subclass of InputFormat used to read the input data
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INPUT_LIST

        public static final java.lang.String INPUT_LIST
        Multiples input data sets specified in the following format: { {input_path1 inputFormatClass1 recordInfoProviderClass1} {input_path2 inputFormatClass2 recordInfoProviderClass2} ... {input_pathN inputFormatClassN recordInfoProviderClassN} }. Where: input_path is specified as in INPUT. inputFormatClass and recordInfoProviderClass are an InputFormat and RecordInfoProvider class implementations used to read the respective input_path.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IS_INPUT_INDEX

        public static final java.lang.String IS_INPUT_INDEX
        Whether a given input path is a spatial index or not. By default it is always false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OUTPUT

        public static final java.lang.String OUTPUT
        The path where the job output will be stored
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OVERWRITE_INDEX_METADATA

        public static final java.lang.String OVERWRITE_INDEX_METADATA
        Whether the spatial index metadata can be overwritten in case it already exists
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUERY_WINDOW

        public static final java.lang.String QUERY_WINDOW
        A query window used in a spatial operation. The value is expected as a GeoJSON geometry.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RECORD_INFO_PROVIDER

        public static final java.lang.String RECORD_INFO_PROVIDER
        A RecordInfoProvider subclass to be used to interpret input records.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SAMPLER_CLASS

        public static final java.lang.String SAMPLER_CLASS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SAMPLING_RATIO

        public static final java.lang.String SAMPLING_RATIO
        Sampling ratio
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SPATIAL_OPERATION

        public static final java.lang.String SPATIAL_OPERATION
        A spatial operation to be performed. Valid values are: IsInside, AnyInteract
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SRID

        public static final java.lang.String SRID
        The SRID of the spatial data
